narrative.fact: Greg Smith taught an LSAT course and looked for ways to reach more students beyond in-person delivery.
Relying on in-person teaching or marketplaces limited branding control and revenue potential for creators.
Greg and his brother Matt custom-built an online version of the course to scale access, proving demand quickly.
Course earnings soon surpassed Greg’s law practice, prompting Greg, Matt, Miranda Lievers, and Matt Payne to formalize a platform for other creators.
Thinkific reports 35,000 customers earning $3.7B+ and impacting 200M+ learners, with a Q3 2024 press release citing 50,000+ active customers.
Positions itself as a learning commerce platform bundling courses, communities, memberships, downloads, and integrated payments under the creator’s brand.
Publicly traded on TSX (THNC) with Q3 2024 revenue of $17.2M (+15% YoY) and $58.0M ARR; headquartered in Vancouver, Canada.

story_judgement.reason: Founder-built MVP story is documented, large-scale usage and earnings are reported, and recent financial results confirm growth and traction.
